meanings.definition: Plan made in secret by a group of people to do something illegal or harmful to someone else.
meanings.sent1: The counterplotting of the thieves was discovered by the police.
meanings.sent2: The counterplotting of the spies was elaborate and well-coordinated.
meanings.sent3: The counterplotting of the students to sneak out of class was quickly foiled by the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The counterplotting of the rival gangs led to a dangerous turf war.
meanings.sent5: The counterplotting of the villains in the movie kept the audience on the edge of their seats.

meanings.definition: Act of making a secret plan to do something illegal or harmful to someone else.
meanings.sent1: The counterplotting against the government was a serious offense.
meanings.sent2: She was arrested for her involvement in counterplotting against her business rival.
meanings.sent3: The counterplotting for a surprise party for her friend was almost ruined when he found out.
meanings.sent4: The counterplotting in the mystery novel kept readers guessing until the very end.
meanings.sent5: The counterplotting in the heist movie was full of unexpected twists and turns.
